item.title: What are passkeys?
item.description: Passkeys solve every single one of the problems described above. Intuitive: creating and using passkeys is as simple as consenting to save and use them. No having to create a password. Automatically unique per-service: By design, passkeys are unique per-service. There’s no chance to reuse them. Breach-resistant: A passkey is only stored on a user’s devices. RP servers store public keys. Even servers that assist in the syncing of passkeys across a user’s devices never have the ability to view or use the user’s WebAuthn private keys.
